refsection.title: Introduction
refsection.para: This step is the p:directory-list step with the added ability to filter files from the list based on whether their content matches an expression.

refsection.title: Errors
refsection.para: Errors from the entry body are summarized here.

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: This step works just like p:directory-list except that it defaults to an unbounded depth and the resulting list of files is filtered through a grep, jsonpath, or xpath query option. At most one query option can be provided. It is a dynamic error if more than one query option is provided.

refsection.title: Grep queries
refsection.para: A grep query is a list of regular expressions. In a grep query, each file is read line-by-line and each line is tested against each regular expression (using the standard XPath function matches($line, $expression)). The file remains in the list if any expression is matched on any line. It is a dynamic error if any of the regular expressions is not valid.

refsection.title: JSONPath queries
refsection.para: A jsonpath query is a list of JSONPath expressions. In a JSONPath query, each file is read as a JSON document. If the file isn’t a valid JSON document, it is removed from the list. If it is valid, it is tested against each JSONPath expression. The file remains in the list if any expression returns a non-null result. It is a dynamic error if any of the JSONPath expressions is not valid.

refsection.title: XPath queries
refsection.para: An xpath query is a list of XPath expressions. In an XPath query, each file is read as an XML document. If the file isn’t well-formed XML, it is removed from the list. If it is XML, it is tested against each XPath expression. The file remains in the list if any expression returns an effective boolean value of true. It is a dynamic error if any of the XPath expressions is not valid.
